results.title: Japan: today and tomorrow
results.brief_description: Introducing Japan and showing the close relationship with Australia, which has developed over the last decade. Goods and industrial know-how are traded between the two countries - capital from Japan is used to develop our mineral resources while we supply her people with raw materials and food in ever increasing quantities.

results.title: Japan: the land, the people
results.brief_description: Describes how 83,000,000 people support themselves in a mountainous island nation, small in area, where arable land is extremely limited. The cultivaiton of rice, tea, silkworms and timber and the development of modern industries are shown, as well as Japan’s growth in the post World War II era.

results.title: Japan: The Island Empire
results.creator_credit: International Video Network, Christopher Zrike and Maureen Zrike
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Japan begins to unfold as you enter a Zen temple, then witness an ancient ritual in a Shinto shrine. In the resort of Ibusuki, you will marvel at guests buried to the neck in steaming volcanic sand. Admire the great Buddha of Kamakura and the splendid architecture of 400 year old Himeji Castle. Then plunge into the frantic pace of Tokyo during the Sanja Matsuri Festival.

results.title: Japan: season by season
results.creator_credit: Sakura Motion Pictures and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Spring comes to Japan. The school year starts in April with special ceremonies in every school, kindergarten and university. The educational system is the driving force behind the speedy modernisation and great industrial development of the country. The rainy season heralds summer which is the sporting and shopping season, and of the great Buddhist Festival. Autumn, as well as being harvest season, brings typhoons and chrysanthemums, and autumnal foliage across the land. Most of Japan experiences a mild winter; modern heating and food preservation make thia a “good” season in a barren time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sakura Motion Pictures and Japan. National Tourist Organisation

results.title: Japan: country of delight
results.brief_description: A trip in and around Tokyo, showing the tourist the life and beauty of Japan. Tokyo, with its ten million people, is like Western cities, but has much to offer which is truly Japanese. Yokohama, Nikko and other areas surrounding Tokyo are visited. Shows the life style, industries and arts and crafts as well as the countryside and coastline, ceremonies and festivals.

results.title: Japan: an industrial nation at work
results.brief_description: Describes the industries of Japan, such as shipbuilding, automobile construction, the production of textiles and china-ware, the iron and steel industry, and the pearl industry. Points out the location of the largest industrial cities, and discusses the importance of raw materials which are essential to Japan’s manufacturing industry.

results.title: Japan: an historical overview [Colour]
results.brief_description: The major events in Japan’s long history, from the clan society of about 800BC to today’s parliamentary government. The influence of Buddhism and other cultural elements from Asia; the impact of Western technology; and how the shifting powers of priests, nobles, Shogun and Emperor have affected the destiny of this vigorous island nation.

results.title: Japan: a banquet menu
results.creator_credit: Screenscope, Marilyn Weiner and Hal Weiner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Shows chef Nobuo Iida and his assistants preparing and presenting a traditional Japanese banquet. Highlights the importance of custom and ritual in Japanese cooking.
